summary: UI Merge testing complete. All features working correctly: Desktop sidebar shows 7 items (Home, Send, Bills, People, Businesses, Activity, Settings), Mobile bottom nav shows 5 items (Home, Send, People, Activity, Settings), Home page shows 4 Quick Actions (Find People, Send External, Pay Bills, Receive), Receive modal shows QR code with /pay/@handle URL format, /pay/:handle route works for logged out users showing landing page with login/signup CTAs, /api/profiles/by-handle/:handle endpoint returns public profile data.

desktop_sidebar_tests.7 items in sidebar: PASS - Home, Send, Bills, People, Businesses, Activity, Settings

mobile_bottom_nav_tests.5 items in mobile nav: PASS - Home, Send, People, Activity, Settings
mobile_bottom_nav_tests.Bills NOT in mobile nav: PASS - Bills accessible via Home Quick Actions

pay_by_handle_route_tests.Logged out shows landing page: PASS - Shows target profile with login/signup CTAs

critical_code_review_comments: SenderShell.jsx correctly implements navItems (7 items) and mobileNavItems (5 items)
Home.jsx Receive modal uses QRCodeSVG with URL format: window.location.origin + /pay/@handle
PayByHandle.jsx correctly handles logged out users with landing page
profiles.py /by-handle/:handle endpoint is PUBLIC (no auth required) and returns only public fields
Bills.jsx shows different categories based on profile type (Personal vs Business)
seed_data_creation: Used existing test data: user_e8769e (personal profile)
context_for_next_testing_agent: UI Merge fully tested. Key verifications: 1) Desktop sidebar has 7 items: Home, Send, Bills, People, Businesses, Activity, Settings. 2) Mobile bottom nav has 5 items: Home, Send, People, Activity, Settings (Bills via Home). 3) Home page shows 4 Quick Actions: Find People, Send External, Pay Bills, Receive. 4) Receive modal shows QR code with /pay/@handle URL format, Copy @handle button as primary action, profile switcher at bottom. 5) /pay/:handle route works for logged out users showing landing page with target profile and login/signup CTAs. 6) /api/profiles/by-handle/:handle endpoint returns public profile data (no auth required). 7) Bills route /sender/bills accessible from sidebar. Test data: user_e8769e (personal profile).
